intro: Hoffmannia josefina, commonly known as the Josephina's hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
